dict.string: An Alfred Workflow with dozens of features for Obsidian

if application "Obsidian" is not running then tell application "Obsidian" to activate delay 1.2 end if
tell application "Obsidian" to open location "obsidian://advanced-uri?commandid=quickadd%253ArunQuickAdd"
set parameter to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "parameter") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN"
Search for External Links in your entire vault

timestamp=`date '+%Y-%m-%d_%H-%M'` resolved_bkp_dest=~`echo -n $backup_location | sed -e "s/~//"` backup="$resolved_bkp_dest""/Obsidian-Backup_""$timestamp"".zip" vault=~`echo -n $vault_path | sed -e "s/~//"`
# directory change necessary to avoid zipping root folder # https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/245856/zip-a-file-without-including-the-parent-directory cd $vault zip -r --quiet $backup ./*
# restrict number of backups actual_number=$((max_number_of_bkps + 1)) cd $resolved_bkp_dest ls -t | tail -n +$actual_number | tr '\n' '\0' | xargs -0 rm
echo "$backup"

# INFO # - has Alfred caching enabled, so just using `curl` here is fine # - updated regularly via cronjob # - maintained at the "Search ALL the docs" repo
curl -sL "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chrisgrieser/alfred-docs-searches/main/.github/caches/obsidian-help-index.json"
and Beta Plugins, if BRAT is installed

## 1Ô∏è‚É£ Setting up this workflow for the first time 1. Install the Obsidian plugins [Advanced URI](https://obsidian.md/plugins?id=obsidian-advanced-uri) & [Metadata Extractor](https://obsidian.md/plugins?id=metadata-extractor). 2. Enable both plugins. 3. Set your vault path in the configuration to the left.
**In the Obsidian plugin settings for the "Metadata Extractor"** - Enable `Write JSON files automatically when Obsidian launches`. - Set `Configure frequency for writing the three JSON files` to how often you want the Metadata to be updated. A value like 30 minutes is reasonable. Do **not** change any of the other settings. - Restart Obsidian.
## ‚öôÔ∏è Workflow Configuration - **Some features require additional configuration to the left.** You can get further information on those features at the respective sections of the [documentation](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/shimmering-obsidian/blob/main/README.md). - To configure the hotkeys, double-click the [sky-blue fields](https://i.imgur.com/wlpht7f.png) at the top left of the workflow window.
## Links - üìô [Changelog](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/shimmering-obsidian/releases) - üìì [Documentation of all features](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/shimmering-obsidian/blob/main/README.md) - üêõ [Bug reports](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/shimmering-obsidian/issues) - ‚òïÔ∏è [Buy me a Coffee](https://ko-fi.com/pseudometa) - ‚≠êÔ∏è [Star on GitHub](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/shimmering-obsidian)
## Cheatsheet of some commands - `o`: All notes - `oe`: All external links - `ot`: Tags - `ob`: Bookmarked files/searches - `or`: Recent files - `oa`: Attachments - `oo`: Append/open to scratchpad - `on`: New note - `ow`: Workspace switcher - `ov`: Vault switcher - `oh`: Documentation search - `op`: Search plugins/themes - `o,:` Search settings and installed plugins - `ocss`: Open CSS snippets
---
**This workflow has been created by Chris Grieser (aka pseudometa).** - [Website](https://chris-grieser.de/) - [ResearchGate](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Christopher-Grieser) - [Mastodon](https://pkm.social/@pseudometa) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/in/christopher-grieser-ba693b17a/)

Screenshot into Obsidian
DOUBLE CLICK THIS to set Hotkey. Suggested Hotkey: cmd + shift + 2

workflow-internal function
takes RELATIVE path (with or without heading) and opens it correctly

Append Selection to Scratchpad
DOUBLE CLICK THIS to set Hotkey.
search all external links in vault

OCR Text into Obsidian
DOUBLE CLICK THIS to set Hotkey. Suggested Hotkey: cmd + shift + 1
new file in folder with template
save inputPath & empty query for next script Filter
Path to the vault that you want to control with this Alfred workflow.
Advanced users: If you use a different config folder than the default one.
Reduces the number of emojis used throughout the workflow. (This does not apply to emojis you have explicitly added yourself with the "Supercharged icons" feature further below.)
Heading levels to ignore. Example: `h4 h5 h6` will only show h1, h2 and h3.
Type of link to copy when using `‚åÉ‚èé`
Paste instead of copy when using `‚åÉ‚èé`
Also applies to the Scratchpad feature.
Whether to prompt for text or to append the clipboard content.
Prefix text to insert before text appended. Supports Alfred's "Dynamic Placeholders" to insert things like a date.
Example: `#inbox/to-read` and `#inbox/later` would both be subsumed under `#inbox`.
Location: vault-relative path to a folder where new notes created by `on` should be created. Leave empty to create the new note in the vault root.

Template: Vault-relative path to the template note to use when creating new notes with the `on` command or when browsing a folder via `o`. Any `{{title}}` placeholders in the template will be replaced with the name of the file. (Be aware that the template will be ignored when you use Folder Templates from the Templater Plugin.)

Vault-relative path to your Scratchpad note. When you append `#foobar`, the text will be appended to the section with the heading "foobar". Also supports Alfred's "Dynamic Placeholders" to insert things like a date.
Prefix text to insert before content appended to the Scratchpad. Supports Alfred's "Dynamic Placeholders" to insert things like a date.

Language codes for Tesseract, e.g., `eng+deu` for English and German. You can find out the code for your language(s) here: https://tesseract-ocr.github.io/tessdoc/Data-Files-in-different-versions.html
Prefix to insert before OCR content.

Markdown file where the ORC-text will be saved to. When empty, will save/append to the file `{vault-path}/OCR-Screenshots.md`. Can be a markdown file outside your note and be used independently from Obsidian.
Folder where the image screenshots should be saved to. When empty, will save the images in `{vault-path}/screenshots/`.
Whether to open note after screenshot or OCR screenshot. (Disable this to be able to take screenshots in quick succession without opening Obsidian.)
Destination: Folder where the backups done by the `obackup` command should be saved. Recommended to be a folder outside your vault.

Maximum number of backups that should be stored at the backup destination folder. When the number is reached, every new backup causes the oldest backup to be deleted. (Decrease this number, when your backup folder becomes too big.)
